授業の概要・背景: This course will be taught in English and students will be required to submit some assignments in English. However, students whose primary language is Japanese are encouraged to take this course and and the main text for this course is available in both English and Japanese. Japanese students willing to read the text closely should be able to keep up even if they have some difficulty in English.
授業方法: This course will be taught in a face-to-face format.

評価.学位授与の方針との関連Relationship to Diploma Polic:
This course will help students to understand and analyze problems in international relations, particularly those that deal with those of people from different regions and cultures. In addition, it will help them to develop their powers of autonomous learning by giving them the skills to identify the sorts of problems that require investigation.

評価.成績評価Grading4:
備考　Note
Students will be expected to participate in class discussions and may be asked to complete small assignments from time to time. These will all factor into the participation grade which is twenty-five percent of the final grade. There were also be two short written assignments which will count as fifteen percent of the grade for each assignment. Finally, there will be two in-class exams, a mid-term worth 20% and a final exam worth 25%.
